notes.note: Front end engineer for customer facing responsive websites designed to build brands, generate leads, and bring in visitors through SEO and social networking.
Established myself as a Sitecore Certified Developer (.NET / Sitecore XP 8.0) and helped lead the development effort for moving my company to the Sitecore Platform.
UI/UX lead for website working with customers to gather requirements, wireframe and design user experience, perform usability testing, estimate effort, and task for development.
Developed a troubleshooting system using jQuery, CSS, ASP, XML and SQL that provides decision support for technicians, tracks usage, and collects content quality feedback.
Developed web app using jQuery, CSS and open source SPServices library for SharePoint web services in order to create a unique touch screen user experience for field technicians.
Speaker on topic of using JavaScript with open source library to integrate with SharePoint Web Services API at DevLearn 2013 conference.
Collaborated with instructional designers and partner with business groups to produce web-based multimedia and e-learning content.
Developed HTML/JavaScript and Flash/Actionscript e-learning solutions.
Convert learning modules to SCORM, iPad compatibility (HTML5), server side coding in PHP, and ASP.Net, performance support system using jQuery.
Blog and guest blogging on various eLearning and web development topics.
Develop SCORM web content. SCORM is a JavaScript framework for e-learning interoperability.
Integrate Flash objects into e-learning ActionScript, JavaScript, and Adobe Captivate widgets.
Implementation of a performance support e-learning strategy to reduce employee time requirements and provide self-directed learning options.  (HTML, JavaScript, Flash)
Create requirements and processes for using Saba LMS for delivering e-learning content.
Teach sessions on social, collaborative, and cloud-based computing services to faculty and staff.
Worked for company specializing in web-based collaborative instructional technology.
Managed academic assessment software for desktop and web products including requirements, specs, project management, and product strategy.
Served as product leader for diverse group of team members in England, France, India, and the U.S. using web conferencing, wikis, IM, and other collaborative communication technologies.
Worked with marketing, executives, and other stakeholders to develop long term product roadmap and strategy.
Succeeded in taking over a failed product and making it stable and reliable resulting in expansion of a large customer contract.
Created a popular JavaScript-based quizzing engine used by higher education instructors and textbook publishing companies.
Project lead and developer for a project tracking web site for employees and customers using client and server side web technologies ASP.Net, JavaScript, and SQL.
Project lead and developer for data conversion tools to move data in and out of course management systems such as Blackboard. Developed using VB, XML, and JavaScript.
Project lead and developer for a web-based academic testing system that provides password protection, grading mechanisms, and results savings. (Perl, CGI, C++, VB.Net, JavaScript)
Project lead and web developer for the corporate web site including e-commerce and licensing capabilities. (ASP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
Position held: May 96 – Sep 97, Jan 99 – Mar 03, May 04 – Apr 06 (8 years total)

experiences.title: Director of Academic Technology
experiences.institution: Berry College, School of Mathematical & Natural Sciences

notes.note: Performed computer and technology support, consulting, and training for faculty and staff.
Served on campus-wide IT committee and as liaison with the central IT department and learned the IT organizational structure.
Developed and maintained the school’s web site. (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript)
Performed verification testing of UNIX X-window systems on VME and PCI bus systems for use in air traffic control, military, and other mission critical applications. (Shell Scripting)
Programmed in C to correct defects in X-window server code.
Traveled internationally for training, customer support, and to learn about new products.
Recognized the need for tracking customer service support requests and developed a database application that could be shared among multiple employees over the network. (VB, Access, SQL)
